title: Advice on personal statements. Help!!
content: Does anyone have experience using EssayEdge.com or TheDoctorJob.com for personal statement editing? I'm interested in trying it out, but would like to hear from some previous users first.
posted_time: Post  by futuredoc117 » Thu Jul 07, 2005 5:12 pm

author: anisarit  Guest Posts: 4 Joined: Sat May 21, 2005 4:24 pm
title: Essay Edge
content: I liked Essay Edge, but remember - they don't write for you, they edit! It's expensive, and honestly I don't think it's important enough to pay for. Residencies want to see your board scores, grades, and  letters of recommendation. A personal statement most likely isn't even read until after youve been granted an interview. Good luck!
posted_time: Post  by anisarit » Tue Nov 01, 2005 8:09 pm

title: gen. surg. residency restrictions
content: I just have a question about General surgery residencies...I have Type 1 diabetes, and use an insulin pump, and I am wondering IF there are any restrictions on my entering a gen. surgery residency.....does anyone know the answer to this?  If there are restrictions and all, what can I do about them?
posted_time: Post  by yodadog2 » Mon Oct 04, 2004 7:14 am

author: Theresa Jones, RN  Nurse Posts: 2365 Joined: Tue Sep 28, 2004 10:21 am
title: [no title]
content: Hi yodadog2, The best place to check about any general surgery residency restrictions is your medical school of choice. The director should be able to tell you whether there are any such restrictions that exist in your area. Sincerely, Rntdj
